docs.title: Welcome
docs.text:
Welcome to the MyAccessID UK User Community website! This site provides resources, documentation, and support for users of the MyAccessID platform in the UK.

This community is being set up via the NetworkPlus project Exploring the Governance Requirements for Enabling UK DRIs to Adopt MyAccessID.

Feel free to explore the site and join the community discussions!

docs.title: Upcoming Workshops
docs.text:
See below for information about upcoming MyAccessID UK User Community Workshops

Date/time Subject Event/Location In-person Online Information page 2025-12-0210:00-12:00 Introduction to Federated User Authentication with MyAccessID MyAccessID Online Workshop MyAccessID Online Workshop

docs.title: Past sessions
docs.text: Date/time Subject Event/Location In-person Online 2025-09-2214:30-15:00 Exploring the governance requirements for enabling UK DRIs to adopt MyAccessID NFCS NetworkPlus Autumn Conference, University of Edinburgh, UK

docs.title: MyAccessID Online Workshop
docs.text:
As part of the NFCS Networkplus project Exploring the Governance Requirements for Enabling UK DRIs to Adopt MyAccessID, the MyAccessID UK User Community is hosting a two-hour online workshop on MyAccessID via Microsoft Teams on 2nd December from 10:00 am to 12:00pm.

To take part in the workshop, please register by completing the form below by 5PM on Friday, 28th November:

Register for workshop

Upon registration, you will receive the Microsoft Teams meeting invitation by email in advance of the workshop. The meeting will be recorded, and the workshop materials will be made available afterwards.

docs.title: Workshop Agenda
docs.text:
The workshop will feature talks from Jisc, the STFC Hartree Centre, UCL, the University of Bristol, and the University of Cambridge. Topics will include an introduction to MyAccessID and its potential as a federated IAM solution. DRI providers who have implemented MyAccessID will share their experiences, including existing pain points within the service and potential improvements. The talks will be followed by an open Q&A session.

Start Time Session Speaker / Organisation 10:00 Welcome — 10:05 MyAccessID in Practice: From Concept to Integration in Cambridge’s AIRR Platform University of Cambridge 10:25 The Journey to Get a Connection UCL 10:40 Motivation for Exploring MyAccessID Adoption at STFC Hartree Centre STFC Hartree Centre 10:55 Coffee break — 11:00 Implementing Compliant Authentication and Authorisation using MyAccessID and Keycloak University of Bristol 11:20 MyAccessID Governance and Roadmap in GN5-2 Jisc 11:40 Q&A session —

docs.title: Mailing list
docs.text:
If you are interested, consider subscribing to the IAM4DRI@JISCMAIL.AC.UK mailing list. This list supports discussion, knowledge exchange, case studies, and problem-solving related to federated access approaches.

You can subscribe directly using the link below:

  • Subscribe to the IAM4DRI mailing list

Or visit the mailing list homepage:

  • IAM4DRI mailing list homepage
